intro: Hieracium venetum, commonly known as the Venetian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from June to September. Hieracium venetum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
